intro: Desmonema mucronulatum var. mildbraedii, commonly known as the slender sea holly, is a marine flowering plant that thrives in coastal environments. It is characterized by its small, white flowers and fleshy, succulent leaves adapted to withstand salt and wind. The plant belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is native to southern Australia. Its unique morphology includes a short, thick stem and clustered inflorescences. It plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for small marine organisms.
